string_data:
PRIMARY: Four Just Stop Oil activists (three women aged 21, 30, and 53, and a man aged 23) were arrested near Manchester Airport on suspicion of conspiring to cause public nuisance. Police said they had items intended to cause "damage and significant disruption" to airport operations as part of their campaign to end fossil fuel extraction by 2030.

SECONDARY: No secondary protest actions mentioned.

OTHER FOCAL: The article discusses balancing protest rights with public rights to avoid "unacceptable disruption," and mentions police intelligence-sharing efforts to prevent airport attacks.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral tone, presenting both police concerns about disruption and the protesters' stated nonviolent intentions equally.
